The_Texas_Tenors:
{{Short description|Trio vocal group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Texas Tenors | image = | caption = The Texas Tenors Rise 2017 | origin = United States | years_active = {{start date|2009}}–present | genre = [[Classical crossover]], [[Country music|country]], [[Classical music|Classical]], [[Adult Contemporary]], [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Holiday music|Holiday]], [[Americana (music)|Americana]] | label = The Texas Tenors | website = {{url|thetexastenors.com}} | current_members = Marcus Collins
JC Fisher
John Hagen }} '''The Texas Tenors''' are a three-time [[Emmy Award]]-winning [[classical crossover]], [[trio (music)|trio]] vocal group formed in 2009 by [[country music|country]] singer JC Fisher, pop singer Marcus Collins and [[opera]] singer John Hagen. They were a top four finalist in the [[America's Got Talent (season 4)|fourth season]] of ''[[America's Got Talent]]'', making them the highest ranking vocal group in the show's history.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetexastenors.com/bios/the-texas-tenors|title=The Texas Tenors, 12 Irish Tenors or 3 Redneck Tenors | The Texas Tenors|publisher=thetexastenors.com|access-date=18 January 2014}} In 2013, The trio filmed their first [[PBS]] special with [[Phoenix Symphony|The Phoenix Symphony]], performing songs from their second album ''You Should Dream''. Along with being one of only two acts from ''[[America's Got Talent]]'' (The Texas Tenors and [[Jackie Evancho]]) to star in their own television special for [[PBS]], The Texas Tenors achieved another milestone in 2014 when they were honored with five [[Rocky Mountain Emmy Awards|Emmy Awards]] nominations and three wins for the self-produced special. The group also supports many charitable organizations.thetexastenors.com The group has performed more than 2000 concerts in over 20 countries including [[Great Britain]] and [[China]]. In August 2017, The Texas Tenors premiered their second [[PBS]] special and on September 8, 2017, released their third studio album of the same name, ''Rise'', which debuted at #1 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard Classical Albums Chart]], #1 [[Billboard (magazine)|Heatseeker New Artist Chart]] and #22 [[Billboard (magazine)|Top Current Albums]] resulting in the group's highest charting positions and most successful sales week ever.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/search/charts?f[0]=ts_chart_artistname%3Athe%20texas%20tenors%20&f[1]=ss_bb_type%3Achart_item&type=2&artist=the%20texas%20tenors%20|title=The Texas Tenors Billboard Chart History; The Texas Tenors|publisher=billboard.com/biz|access-date=October 2, 2017}} In 2018, the trio released ''A Collection of Broadway & American Classics'' exclusively at their live concerts and through their website at the request of their fan club. Without distribution or a national campaign, the album debuted at #1 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard Classical Albums Chart]] and spent 10 weeks in the top 10.{{cite web|url= https://www.billboard.com/charts/classical-albums/2018-08-18|title=Billboard Chart; Classical Albums|publisher=billboard.com|access-date=August 8, 2018}} ==Career== ===''America's Got Talent'' (2009)=== The trio auditioned for [[America's Got Talent (season 4)|''America's Got Talent'' season four]], performing a crossover version of "[[Mountain Music (song)|Mountain Music]]". They advanced week after week, finishing in fourth place. ====Performances/Results==== {|class="wikitable" |- ! Week ! Theme ! Song choice ! Original artist ! Performance order ! Result |- | Audition | N/A | "[[Mountain Music (song)|Mountain Music]]" | [[Alabama (American band)|Alabama]] | N/A | Advanced |- | Top 40
Group 2 | N/A | "[[God Bless the U.S.A.]]" | [[Lee Greenwood]] | N/A | Advanced |- | Top 20
Group 1 | N/A | "[[Unchained Melody]]" | [[The Righteous Brothers]] | N/A | Advanced |- | Top 10 | N/A | "[[My Way]]" | [[Frank Sinatra]] | N/A | '''4th Place''' |} ===After ''America's Got Talent''=== The group's self-titled debut album, ''The Texas Tenors'', was released in 2009. The album contained all four songs that were performed on ''America's Got Talent'', some [[arias]] such as "[[Nessun dorma]]" and "[[La donna è mobile]]" as well as other songs. In 2011, the group remastered the album and included some new material. The album has sold 225,000 units to date.{{cite web|url=http://thetexastenors.com/albums/country-roots-classical-sound-remastered-special-edition/|title=Country Roots: Classical Sound (Remastered Special Edition) | The Texas Tenors|publisher=thetexastenors.com|access-date=18 January 2014}} Their second studio album, ''You Should Dream'', was released on December 10, 2013. Produced by [[Academy Award]] and [[Grammy Award|Grammy]] nominated producer [[Nigel Wright (record producer)|Nigel Wright]], ''You Should Dream'' features "[[God Bless the USA]]", "[[Unchained Melody]]", [[The Rolling Stones]]' "[[Wild Horses (The Rolling Stones song)|Wild Horses]]", two original songs and a 65 piece orchestra.{{cite web|url=http://thetexastenors.com/eshop/?slug=index&cPath=23|title=eShop | The Texas Tenors|publisher=thetexastenors.com|access-date=18 January 2014}} The Texas Tenors are one of only two acts from [[America's Got Talent]] to star in their own television special for [[PBS]], the group achieved a milestone in 2014 when they were honored with five [[Rocky Mountain Emmy Awards|Emmy Awards]] nominations and three wins. In 2017, The Texas Tenors' third studio album ''Rise'' debuted at #1 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Classical Albums]] Chart and #5 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Top Country Albums]] Chart resulting in the most successful week of sales for the group and their highest charting positions to date. ===''America's Got Talent: The Champions'' (2019)=== In 2019, The Texas Tenors competed on ''[[America's Got Talent: The Champions]]''.
